TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and currently lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , at DATE , the applicant lawfully entered GPE together with his parents and CARDINAL siblings . Subsequently , he was legally resident in GPE . His parents , who were lawfully employed , acquired NORP nationality . The applicant attended school in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant . He was suspected of , inter alia , having broken into cars , shops and vending machines ; having stolen empties from a stock ground ; having forced another boy to steal CARDINAL NORP schillings from the latter ’s mother ; having pushed , kicked and bruised this boy ; and of having used a motor vehicle without the owner ’s authorisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was granted an unlimited settlement permit ( Niederlassungsbewilligung ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( GPE ) convicted the applicant on CARDINAL counts of aggravated gang burglary and attempted aggravated gang burglary ( gewerbsmäßiger Bandendiebstahl ) , forming a gang ( Bandenbildung ) , extortion ( GPE ) , assault ( NORP ) , and unauthorised use of a vehicle ( unbefugter MONEY ) , offences committed DATE and DATE . He was sentenced to DATE months’ imprisonment , CARDINAL of which were suspended on probation . The sentence was accompanied by an order to undergo drug therapy .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and further criminal proceedings were opened against him relating to a series of burglaries committed DATE and DATE . The applicant and his accomplices were suspected of having broken into shops or restaurants , where they stole cash and goods . On DATE ORG remanded him in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant on CARDINAL counts of aggravated burglary and attempted aggravated burglary , and sentenced him to QUANTITY months’ imprisonment . When fixing the sentence the court noted the applicant ’s confession as a mitigating circumstance , and the number of offences committed and the rapid relapse into crime after the last conviction as aggravating circumstances . It also observed that the applicant , though still living with his parents , had completely escaped their educational influence , had repeatedly been absent from home and had dropped out of school . It further noted that the applicant had failed to comply with the order to undergo drug therapy . Consequently , the suspension of the prison term imposed by the judgment of DATE was revoked . Following ORG judgment , the applicant served his prison term .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ) , relying on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE ( PERSON ) , imposed a DATE exclusion order on the applicant . Having regard to the applicant ’s convictions , it found that it was contrary to the public interest to allow him to stay in GPE any longer . Considering the applicant ’s relapse into crime after his first conviction , the public interest in the prevention of disorder and crime outweighed the applicant ’s interest in staying in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant , assisted by counsel , appealed . He submitted that the exclusion order violated his rights under LAW as he was a minor who had come to GPE at DATE , his entire family lived in GPE and he had no relatives in GPE . He also referred to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE , pursuant to which an exclusion order could not be issued against an alien who had been lawfully residing in GPE from DATE .
CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE , ORG ) dismissed the appeal . It confirmed ORG finding .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged complaints both with ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) and ORG ) . He stressed that he had come to GPE at DATE , had attended school in GPE and could not speak NORP . He had no relatives or other social contacts in GPE . He also stressed the fact that he was still a minor .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint and found that the exclusion order was justified under LAW . It observed that the applicant had come to GPE only at DATE , whereas DATE according to its constant case - law – section CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE prohibited an exclusion order only in respect of aliens who had been legally resident from DATE or younger . Considering the gravity and number of offences committed by the applicant , the fact that the first conviction had rapidly been followed by a second one and the severity of the penalties imposed , it found that the exclusion order did not constitute a disproportionate interference with the applicant ’s rights under LAW , despite his lengthy residence and family ties in GPE .
CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE , ORG suspended the effects of the exclusion order pending its decision .

CARDINAL . The applicant was released from prison on DATE not having benefited from early release . According to the information given by counsel at the hearing , the applicant finished school during his prison term and helped in his father ’s transport business after his release .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Constitutional Court declined to deal with the applicant ’s complaint for lack of prospects of success .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a number of unsuccessful attempts were made to serve an order on the applicant to leave GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a fresh order requiring the applicant to leave GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the order was served on the applicant at his GPE address and subsequently ORG ordered his detention with a view to his expulsion . He was arrested on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was deported to GPE . According to information given by counsel at the hearing , the applicant did not commit any further offences in GPE and has found employment there .
CARDINAL . At the hearing , the Government informed the ORG that the exclusion order will expire on DATE , that is DATE after its issue ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . At the material time LAW ( PERSON ) was in force . Sections CARDINAL to CARDINAL , in so far as relevant , read as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) An exclusion order can be issued against an alien if it can justifiably be supposed , on the basis of specific facts , that his residence
CARDINAL . NORP endangers public peace , order and security ; or
CARDINAL . NORP runs counter to other public interests specified in LAW .
( CARDINAL ) The existence of specific facts within the meaning of paragraph CARDINAL shall be made out , in particular , if an alien

CARDINAL . NORP has been sentenced by a domestic court to an unsuspended term of imprisonment of DATE ; to a term of imprisonment partly suspended on probation ; or to a term of imprisonment of DATE suspended on probation ; or has been convicted by final judgment more than once for the same pernicious tendency to commit criminal acts . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Should there be an interference with the alien ’s private or family life on account of ... an exclusion order , such a deprivation of the right of residence shall be permissible only if necessary as a matter of urgency in furtherance of CARDINAL of the aims set out in LAW .

( CARDINAL ) ... an exclusion order shall not in any case be issued if its effects on the alien and his family ’s situation outweigh the adverse consequences of not taking such a measure . In weighing the above factors , regard shall be had in particular to the following circumstances :
CARDINAL . NORP the period of residence and the extent to which the alien or members of his family have integrated ;
CARDINAL . the strength of family or other ties . ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) An exclusion order shall not be issued if
CARDINAL . the alien has grown up in the host country from early childhood and has been lawfully settled there for DATE . ”

CARDINAL . ORG held that only aliens who had grown up in GPE from DATE or younger had grown up there “ from early childhood ” within the meaning of section CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see , for instance , decision of DATE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL ; judgment of DATE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL ; and judgment of DATE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( ORG ) provides :
“ Minors are persons who have not yet reached DATE . ... ”
This version of LAW entered into force on DATE . Before that date the age of majority was DATE .
CARDINAL . The following CARDINAL ORG are of particular interest in the context of the present case .
CARDINAL . The first one is Committee of Ministers Recommendation Rec(CARDINAL)CARDINAL concerning the security of residence of long - term migrants , adopted on DATE , which states , inter alia :
“ CARDINAL . As regards the protection against expulsion

( a ) Any decision on expulsion of a long - term immigrant should take account , having due regard to the principle of proportionality and in the light of ORG Rights’ constant case - law , of the following criteria :
– the personal behaviour of the immigrant ;
– the duration of residence ;
– the consequences for both the immigrant and his or her family ;
– existing links of the immigrant and his or her family to his or her country of origin .

( b ) In application of the principle of proportionality as stated in paragraph CARDINAL ( a ) , member GPE should duly take into consideration the length or type of residence in relation to the seriousness of the crime committed by the long - term immigrant . More particularly , member GPE may provide that a long - term immigrant should not be expelled
– after DATE of residence , except in the case of a conviction for a criminal offence where sentenced to in excess of CARDINAL years’ imprisonment without suspension ; and
– after DATE of residence , except in the case of a conviction for a criminal offence where sentenced to in excess of CARDINAL years’ imprisonment without suspension .
After DATE of residence , a long - term immigrant should no longer be expellable .

( c ) ORG - term immigrants born on the territory of the member ORG or admitted to the member ORG before DATE , who have been lawfully and habitually resident , should not be expellable once they have reached DATE .
Long - term immigrants who are minors may in principle not be expelled .

( d ) In any case , each member ORG should have the option to provide in its internal law that a long - term immigrant may be expelled if he or she constitutes a serious threat to national security or public safety . ”

CARDINAL . The second one is Committee of Ministers Recommendation Rec(CARDINAL)CARDINAL on the legal status of persons admitted for family reunification , adopted on DATE . It states that where the withdrawal of or the refusal to renew a residence permit , or the expulsion of a family member , is being considered :

“ ... member GPE should have proper regard to criteria such as the person ’s place of birth , his age of entry on the territory , the length of residence , his family relationships , the existence of family ties in the country of origin and the solidity of social and cultural ties with the country of origin . Special consideration should be paid to the best interest and well - being of children . ”
CARDINAL . The United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child of DATE , to which GPE is ORG , provides :
“ For the purposes of the present Convention , a child means every human being below DATE unless under the law applicable to the child , majority is attained earlier . ”

“ In all actions concerning children , whether undertaken by public or private social welfare institutions , courts of law , administrative authorities or legislative bodies , the best interests of the child shall be a primary consideration . ”

“ GPE Parties recognise the right of every child alleged as , accused of , or recognised as having infringed the penal law to be treated in a manner consistent with the promotion of the child ’s sense of dignity and worth , which reinforces the child ’s respect for the human rights and fundamental freedoms of others and takes into account the child ’s age and the desirability of promoting the child ’s reintegration and the child ’s assuming a constructive role in society . ”

CARDINAL . The Committee on the Rights of the ORG , in its concluding observations on the second periodic report of GPE ( see ORG / C/CARDINAL/Add . CARDINAL , DATE , § § DATE and DATE ) , expressed its concern about the increasing number of persons below the age of CARDINAL placed in detention , a measure disproportionately affecting those of foreign origin , and recommended with regard to LAW that appropriate measures to promote the recovery and social integration of children involved in the juvenile justice system be taken .

CARDINAL . In its General Comment no . CARDINAL ( DATE ) on children ’s rights in juvenile justice ( see ORG / C / GC/CARDINAL , DATE , § MONEY ) , ORG emphasised with regard to measures in the sphere of juvenile justice :

“ ... that the reaction to an offence should always be in proportion not only to the circumstances and the gravity of the offence , but also to the age , lesser culpability , circumstances and needs of the child , as well as to the various and particularly long - term needs of the society . A strictly punitive approach is not in accordance with the leading principles for juvenile justice spelled out in LAW on the Rights of the LAW ] ... In cases of severe offences by children , measures proportionate to the circumstances of the offender and to the gravity of the offence may be considered , including considerations of the need of public safety and sanctions . In the case of children , such considerations must always be outweighed by the need to safeguard the well - being and the best interests of the child and to promote his / her reintegration ” .

CARDINAL . Given the membership of GPE to ORG ( as from DATE ) and of GPE ( as from DATE ) the following CARDINAL directives should be noted among those dealing with matters of migration , including the requirements for expulsion of nationals of another member ORG and third - country nationals .
CARDINAL . NORP The first one is ORG of DATE concerning the status of third - country nationals who are long - term residents . It provides :
“ CARDINAL . Member GPE may take a decision to expel a long - term resident solely where he / she constitutes an actual and sufficiently serious threat to public policy or public security .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision referred to in paragraph CARDINAL shall not be founded on economic considerations .
CARDINAL . NORP Before taking a decision to expel a long - term resident , member GPE shall have regard to the following factors :
( a ) the duration of residence in their territory ;
( b ) the age of the person concerned ;
( c ) the consequences for the person concerned and family members ;
( d ) links with the country of residence or the absence of links with the country of origin .

CARDINAL . The second one is Council Directive CARDINAL/CARDINAL/EC of ORG and of ORG on the right of citizens of the Union and their family members to move and reside freely within the territory of the member States . It provides :

“ CARDINAL . Subject to the provisions of this chapter , member GPE may restrict the freedom of movement and residence of Union citizens and their family members , irrespective of nationality , on grounds of public policy , public security or public health . These grounds shall not be invoked to serve economic ends .

CARDINAL . Measures taken on grounds of public policy or public security shall comply with the principle of proportionality and shall be based exclusively on the personal conduct of the individual concerned . Previous criminal convictions shall not in themselves constitute grounds for taking such measures .

The personal conduct of the individual concerned must represent a genuine , present and sufficiently serious threat affecting CARDINAL of the fundamental interests of society . Justifications that are isolated from the particulars of the case or that rely on considerations of general prevention shall not be accepted .

“ CARDINAL . NORP Before taking an expulsion decision on grounds of public policy or public security , the host member State shall take account of considerations such as how long the individual concerned has resided in its territory , his / her age , state of health , family and economic situation , social and cultural integration into the host member ORG and the extent of his / her links with the country of origin .

CARDINAL . NORP The host member ORG may not take an expulsion decision against Union citizens or their family members , irrespective of nationality , who have the right of permanent residence on its territory , except on serious grounds of public policy or public security .
CARDINAL . An expulsion decision may not be taken against Union citizens , except if the decision is based on imperative grounds of public security , as defined by member ORG , if they :
( a ) have resided in the host member ORG for DATE ; or
( b ) are a minor , except if the expulsion is necessary for the best interests of the child , as provided for in LAW on the Rights of the Child of DATE . ”

CARDINAL . The case - law of ORG of ORG ( ECJ ) shows that measures of non - admission or expulsion have to rely on the individual conduct of the person concerned and on an assessment of whether the person concerned presents a genuine , present and sufficiently serious threat to public policy , public security or public health .
CARDINAL . In its LOC and Others and PERSON v. PERSON judgment of DATE ( Joined Cases C–CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CCARDINAL/CARDINAL , operative part , points CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) the ECJ stated :

“ CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of Directive CARDINAL/CARDINAL precludes a national practice whereby the national courts may not take into consideration , in reviewing the lawfulness of the expulsion of a national of another member ORG , factual matters which occurred after the final decision of the competent authorities which may point to the cessation or the substantial diminution of the present threat which the conduct of the person concerned constitutes to the requirements of public policy . That is so , above all , if a lengthy period has elapsed between the date of the expulsion order and that of the review of that decision by the competent court .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL ORG and LAW CARDINAL/CARDINAL preclude legislation and national practices whereby a national of another member ORG who has received a particular sentence for specific offences is ordered to be expelled , in spite of family considerations being taken into account , on the basis of a presumption that that person must be expelled , without proper account being taken of his personal conduct or of the danger which he represents for the requirements of public policy .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL ORG and Directive CARDINAL do not preclude the expulsion of a national of another member ORG who has received a particular sentence for specific offences and who , on the one hand , constitutes a present threat to the requirements of public policy and , on the other hand , has resided for DATE in the host member ORG and can plead family circumstances against that expulsion , provided that the assessment made on a case - by - case basis by the national authorities of where the fair balance lies between the legitimate interests at issue is made in compliance with the general principles of Community law and , in particular , by taking proper account of respect for fundamental rights , such as the protection of family life . ”
CARDINAL . In its Commission of the NORP Communities v. GPE judgment of DATE ( Case C-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , operative part , point CARDINAL ) the ORG stated :

“ ... by refusing entry into the territory of LOC to the Agreement on the gradual abolition of checks at their common borders , signed on DATE at ORG , to Mr PERSON , and by refusing to issue a visa for the purpose of the entry into that territory to Mr PERSON and Mr Bouchair , nationals of a third country who are the spouses of member - State nationals , on the sole ground that they were persons for whom alerts were entered in FAC for the purposes of refusing them entry , without first verifying whether the presence of those persons constituted a genuine , present and sufficiently serious threat affecting CARDINAL of the fundamental interests of society , GPE has failed to fulfil its obligations under LAW Directive CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on the coordination of special measures concerning the movement and residence of foreign nationals which are justified on grounds of public policy , public security or public health . ”
